signal.name: alien
signal.notes: Descriptive tag for catching alien sources.

signal.name: AoE
signal.notes: Descriptive tag for catching AOE sources.

signal.name: apex wall
signal.notes: Used specifically for Apex Wall

signal.name: break mimic mimicry
signal.notes: If a mimic ever receives this and is mimicked, it should break out.

signal.name: break mind control
signal.notes: Need to break this out of nullwave because there's no way to handle a 0 value so they effectively would free each other.

signal.name: break player mimicry
signal.notes: Player specific signal for NPCs to use to break player out of mimicry.

signal.name: bump
signal.notes: Some objects will "bump" the NPC but cause no damage

signal.name: corrosive
signal.notes: Damages suit integrity.

signal.name: crush
signal.notes: Slower more inevitable collision like getting squished under an elevator, recycler, and self-damage from collisions. Also mimic grab attack.

signal.name: disrepair
signal.notes: Damages weapons.

signal.name: exterior
signal.notes: Used by the boundary enforcing package to prevent the player from escaping into space even when in mimic form (caught by the modiifer).

signal.name: grenade
signal.notes: Just a tag used for determining if signal source is a charge

signal.name: impact
signal.notes: Fast moving collisions that generate damage: projectiles, thrown objects.

signal.name: hazard
signal.notes: Need a flag to filter hazard signals on voltaic phantom.

signal.name: humanHeadTrigger
signal.notes: Used in psychoshock player to make human heads explode instantly.

signal.name: leverage
signal.notes: Just a tag for flagging package as a leverage source.

signal.name: lift
signal.notes: Used by player lift power.

signal.name: NPC
signal.notes: Descriptive tag for catching NPC sources.

signal.name: NPC pistol
signal.notes: Used in NPC bullet packages to be caught in their Disposition Factors to minimize them shooting each other in the back.

signal.name: laser
signal.notes: This is comes from the military operator weapon. Typically pure damage.

signal.name: operator aid
signal.notes: Just a tag to know the operators are being helpful and healing/repairing player.

signal.name: qbeam
signal.notes: Player's Qbeam weapon, digdug all or nothing kill, not typically direct damage.

signal.name: robot
signal.notes: Descriptive tag for catching robot sources.

signal.name: scripted npc damage
signal.notes: Used by LDs only as a tag so that NPCs to take damage, but the player can aviod it.

signal.name: scripted player damage
signal.notes: Kill the player with no fanfare or feedback.

signal.name: self-damage
signal.notes: Means that this signal package is allowed to damage the source sending off the package.

signal.name: shatter
signal.notes: Breakables listen to this as a cue to break without any better reason.

signal.name: threat
signal.notes: used to tell an NPC to turn hostile to the instigator

signal.name: wont kill player
signal.notes: If this signal is in a player-damaging package then the player will not be killed by the damage.
